remixlab.dandelion.agent

Class KeyboardAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • remixlab.bias.core.Agent
      • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionAgent<K>
        • remixlab.bias.agent.ActionKeyboardAgent<KeyboardProfile<Constants.KeyboardAction>>
          • remixlab.dandelion.agent.KeyboardAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Constants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Scene.ProsceneKeyboard

    public class KeyboardAgent
extends ActionKeyboardAgent<KeyboardProfile<Constants.KeyboardAction>>
implements Constants
    An ActionKeyboardAgent that handles Dandelion keyboard actions.

    Dandelion actions can be handled by the AbstractScene, or by an InteractiveFrame or an InteractiveEyeFrame. This class implements a generic Keyboard Agent that represents a keyboard device that handles actions to be executed only by the AbstractScene (InteractiveFrame and InteractiveEyeFrame actions are handled exclusively by an ActionWheeledBiMotionAgent).

    The agent uses its keyboardProfile() to parse the BogusEvent to obtain a dandelion action, which is then sent to the AbstractScene (Agent.inputGrabber()) for its final execution. In case the grabber is not an instance of AbstractScene, but a different object which behavior you implemented ( ActionAgent.alienGrabber()), the agent sends the raw BogusEvent to it.

    Simply retrieve the keyboardProfile() to bind an action to a shortcut, to remove it, or to check your current bindings. Default bindings are provided for convenience (setDefaultShortcuts()).

    Note that keyboardProfile() shortcuts are KeyboardShortcuts.

      • feed

        public KeyboardEvent feed()
        Description copied from class: Agent
        Callback (user-space) event reduction routine. Obtains data from the outside world and returns a BogusEvent i.e., reduces external data into a BogusEvent. Automatically call by the main event loop ( InputHandler.handle()). See ProScene's Space-Navigator example.
        Overrides:
        feed in class Agent
        See Also:
        InputHandler.handle()
